title: BMI : adult 's body mass index in England 2018 , by gender and age
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Men, and Women. The y axis represents Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Men, and Women are gradually increasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared in descending order is: 1. Men, and lastly, 2. Women.
Overall across the Year, Men mostly maintained the highest Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared when compared to others with a mean value of 27.46, and it peaked at 55-64_years.
Women mostly had the least Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared with a mean value of 27.43, which peaked at 65-74_years with a value of 28.5.
yAxis: Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared

The lines ordered according to average values of Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared in descending order is: 1. Men, and lastly, 2. Women.

The difference of Mean BMI in kilograms per meter squared between Men and Women is roughly same at Year 75_years_and_over compared to the Year 16-24_years.
